traits.role_among_twelve: prominent disciple and spokesperson; confesses Jesus as Christ but rebuked for misunderstanding suffering.
traits.portrayal: impulsive and bold, both exemplary and failing disciple.
traits.fate_or_ending: restoration implied but not narrated in detail; mentioned as recipient of resurrection message.

traits.role_among_twelve: chief disciple given special revelations and responsibilities.
traits.portrayal: confesses Jesus as Messiah and Son of God; given keys of the kingdom yet still capable of failure.
traits.fate_or_ending: commissioned with the others after resurrection; future role implied rather than narrated.

traits.portrayal: denies Jesus but is prayed for and later confirms the brothers.
traits.fate_or_ending: restoration hinted and leadership anticipated; detailed ministry continues in Acts.

traits.role_among_twelve: prominent disciple who runs to the tomb and is reinstated by the risen Jesus.
traits.portrayal: both impulsive and devoted; questioned about love and tasked to shepherd the flock.
traits.fate_or_ending: future martyrdom hinted in symbolic language; leadership role affirmed.

traits.role_among_twelve: primary spokesperson for the Jerusalem church and mission to Jews.
traits.portrayal: bold preacher and miracle worker, interpreter of events at Pentecost and key figure in early mission.
traits.fate_or_ending: leadership gradually gives way to Paul; Peter exits narrative after key missions.
